creditline: Gift of funds from John E. Andrus III and other donors and the Winton Jones Endowment Fund for Prints and Drawings
description: portrait of a man with a beard trimmed into two points and a long, thin moustache, wearing a cape and a cloak with puffed sleeves; coat of arms on wall over man's PR shoulder; view of a village with a castle on a mountain behind man's PL shoulder; text in Greek at bottom
inscription:
Inscription

on back, in pencil: [Roggenbach] and [SD]
provenance: Friedrich Winkler, art historian and curator at the Staatliche Museun Berlin. [Pia Gallo, New York]
text: Need someone to do you a favor' If you lived in mid-16th-century Nuremberg, this was the guy you called. As city consul, he was the fixer. No need for ostentatious display of gold chains when youâ€™re endowed with potency like his, just a glint will suffice.
title: Portrait of Georg von Roggenbach at age 38
